schema:name: Regional species loss associated with UK consumption (the number of species predicted to be committed to extinction if current conditions continue, per ecoregion), 2005 to 2021

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:headline: Indicator A4: Global biodiversity impacts of UK economic activity / sustainable consumption

schema:variableMeasured: number of species predicted to be committed to extinction if current conditions continue, per ecoregion
notes: The predicted number of regional species lost as a result of agricultural land use is used to estimate the biodiversity impacts of UK consumption. It provides an estimate of the species committed to extinction in the absence of habitat restoration. For K1c, this refers to the UK consumption of crop commodities only using the impact per tonne of production for different crop groups and links this to the respective territories in the IOTA framework to model the number of species at risk.

columns.name: year
columns.schema:description: The year range for the data present

columns.name: value
columns.schema:description: The regional species loss associated with UK consumption (the number of species predicted to be committed to extinction if current conditions continue, per ecoregion)
